issue.title: Nupic.core C++ support
issue.body:
Would it be possible to use this visualization with the c++ version of NuPIC? 
I guess a workaround would be using Python with C++ wrappers and then this code, would that work?

issue.title: Missing module "zope.interface" for Twisted when running example code
issue.body:
I followed these directions to install:

``` sh
cd sanity-nupic
git submodule update --init --recursive
brew install leiningen
python setup.py develop --user
cd htmsanity/nupic/sanity
lein cljsbuild once demos
cd ../../..
python examples/hotgym.py
```

And I get this error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "examples/hotgym.py", line 5, in <module>
    from htmsanity.nupic.runner import SanityRunner
  File "/Users/mtaylor/nta/sanity-nupic/htmsanity/nupic/runner.py", line 10, in <module>
    from autobahn.twisted.websocket import WebSocketServerFactory
  File "/Users/mtaylor/Library/Python/2.7/lib/python/site-packages/autobahn-0.14.0-py2.7.egg/autobahn/twisted/__init__.py", line 33, in <module>
    import twisted
  File "/Users/mtaylor/Library/Python/2.7/lib/python/site-packages/twisted/__init__.py", line 55, in <module>
    _checkRequirements()
  File "/Users/mtaylor/Library/Python/2.7/lib/python/site-packages/twisted/__init__.py", line 39, in _checkRequirements
    raise ImportError(required + ": no module named zope.interface.")
ImportError: Twisted requires zope.interface 3.6.0 or later: no module named zope.interface.
```

Twisted 16.2.0 is installed (I also tried uninstalling and re-installing). `easy_install zope.interface` as [suggested here](http://stackoverflow.com/a/14637032/154560) did not help.

issue.title: Start server with 1 command, stop hardcoding port 24601
Stop with all the Keywords
issue.body:
We're talking to a ClojureScript frontend, so we send a lot of keywords. They're nice in Clojure, but they're painful in Python.

One solution that I don't love:
- change all dictionary keys to strings when the server receives them
- change all dictionary keys to keywords when the server sends them

The problem: it will be impossible for the server to send actual strings as dictionary keys.

In general, anything that involves a "translate at runtime" will have a flexibility trade-off. I think the real solution is going to be to switch from keywords to strings inside ComportexViz. Maybe not completely, but hopefully enough that servers never have to send or receive a keyword.

issue.title: Make the API more Pythony
issue.body:
Currently I pass a model and function into the `startRunner` function.

That's not idiomatic Python. In fact, @marionleborgne audibly cringed when she saw [this line](https://github.com/mrcslws/comportexviz-nupic/blob/d3a3d08e61cebeaa924f111e964452ac09883265/examples/hotgym-plot.py#L84) where I'm using closures in Python.

So: switch to OOP. Abstract methods, `self`, etc.

issue.title: Add to nupic-community repo
issue.body: I think this would make it easier to find :)

issue.title: Distal synapse-saving throws an exception when using temporal_memory.py
issue.body:
In the model params, change 'temporalImp' to 'tm_py'. Run the server, and enable distal synapse-saving. 

Result: Everything breaks.

Explanation: I originally built this to work with the default case ('cpp', a.k.a. TP10X2.py).

Need to grab the synapses using the new Connections class.

issue.title: Stop hardcoding hotgym
Cell and segment selection. Currently we just display all distal synapses.
The cell segment diagrams deserve an explanation in Help
Option: Only save distal synapses for active / predictive columns

Distal segment data (percent of thresholds, etc.)
Make the "run / pause" button work. (Currently only single-stepping works.)
Enable toggling synapse-saving (i.e. create a "fast mode")
